Its heads are gathered when the barley is beginning to swell, dried in the shade for nine days and thoroughly dried in the sun. The fruit does not ripen all together, but a part in the following year. It is called 'the nut, and for this reason the Greeks have surnamed this tithymallus caryiteS.⁶ It is gathered when the harvest is ready, washed‚ and then dried.
